title: Privacy risk with license plate cameras

content.question:
A cityâ€™s police department has installed cameras throughout city streets. The cameras capture and store license plate data from cars driven and parked throughout the city. The authorities use recorded license plate data to identify stolen cars and to enforce parking regulations.
Which of the following best describes a privacy risk that could occur if this method of data collection is misused?

choices.label: The cameras may not be able to read license plates in poor weather conditions.
Local business owners could lose customers who are unwilling to park in the city.
Traffic personnel who work for the city could lose their jobs if their services are no longer needed.
The vehicle location data could be used to monitor the movements of city residents.

content.answer: The vehicle location data could be used to monitor the movements of city residents.

skill.text: Skill 5.D: Describe the impact of gathering data.
